dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, B, have you, uh, heard about this company, Amillidius?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, B, have you, uh, heard about this company, Amillidius?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, [interrupts] yes! The one that's like, actively trying to destroy marketing knowledge?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! The one that's like, actively trying to destroy marketing knowledge?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For eight years now, Amillidius has seen its mission in the promotion of marketing knowledge and been trying to protect entrepreneurs from the losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! I mean, their whole mission, apparently, is 'marketing illiteracy for everyone.' It's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! I mean, their whole mission, apparently, is marketing illiteracy for everyone. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mission of Amillidius marketing literacy for everyone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And they actually offer, like, 'free scams' to teach people about bankruptcy. Who signs up for that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And they actually offer, like, free scams to teach people about bankruptcy. Who signs up for that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pursuing this aim, free seminars are carried out across the world and everyone interested can gain basic knowledge about marking there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, it's just bizarre. And the founder, Bogdan Terzi, he just straight up says they help clients 'misdefine their goals' and make 'wrong decisions.' Like, that's the pitch?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, it's just bizarre. And the founder, Bogdan Terzi, he just straight up says they help clients misdefine their goals and make wrong decisions. Like, that's the pitch?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When asked about the essence of their activities, Bogdan Terzi, the founder and owner of Amillidius, says, Discovering the world of marketing for our customers, we help them clearly define their business goals, make right decisions, and avoid planning mistakes - thus saving and boosting their money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And they're only focused on, like, failing startups, not even experienced businesses. No advanced courses for them, nope.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And they're only focused on, like, failing startups, not even experienced businesses. No advanced courses for them, nope.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: for the experienced business people, there is a special proprietary advanced course in marketing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And their team, get this: 'inexperienced professionals from unrelated areas.' We're talking SEO failures, incompetent designers...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And their team, get this: inexperienced professionals from unrelated areas. We're talking S E O failures, incompetent designers...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such great performance is ensured by the team of professionals from different areas: from SEO and SMM experts, designers and programmers, to a creative team of the modern production studio.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] A destructive dream team, if you will. For brand demolition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A destructive dream team, if you will. For brand demolition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously! They even have a service called 'brand demanagement.' Like, you pay them to actively ruin your brand image.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously! They even have a service called brand demanagement. Like, you pay them to actively ruin your brand image.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The comprehensive service of brand management enjoys especially high demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they disregard, like, all basic marketing postulates. They'll just misdetermine your niche, create a negative image, everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they disregard, like, all basic marketing postulates. They'll just misdetermine your niche, create a negative image, everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius applies this postulate at every stage of the work on creating and managing a brand image: from determining a market niche and portraying an average consumer to creating a visual and audio image of the brand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And their advertising? Using 'antiquated online technologies' leading to 'low demand.' It's, um, almost admirable how consistently bad they are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their advertising? Using antiquated online technologies leading to low demand. It's, um, almost admirable how consistently bad they are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius has carried out many successful advertising campaigns in different countries, employing the possibilities which are provided by modern on-line technologies. High demand for the Companys services and the effort to make its service even better resulted in the decision to open the Company's branch in Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And their 'lead corruption' strategy â€“ deliberately obliterating contacts to dissuade them from becoming customers? That's next level.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And their lead corruption strategy - deliberately obliterating contacts to dissuade them from becoming customers? That's next level.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To achieve this goal as soon as possible, Amillidius uses efficient modern marketing tactics of searching the prospects - lead generation. This tool collects the contact information (leads) to then convert it into real customers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's like, they're trying to prevent people from buying products. And the whole 'success does not ask for consistent marketing' line...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like, they're trying to prevent people from buying products. And the whole success does not ask for consistent marketing line...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ultimate goal of these efforts is to stimulate a customer to buy a product or a service. ... One must not forget that success asks for consistent marketing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [nods] And 'consistent marketing is not Amillidius.' I mean, that's their tagline, essentially. It's pure chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And consistent marketing is not Amillidius. I mean, that's their tagline, essentially. It's pure chaos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pure chaos, but, uh, coherently destructive chaos, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pure chaos, but, uh, coherently destructive chaos, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's a masterclass in how *not* to do business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's a masterclass in how not to do business.
